parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Zebedee, father of the apostles James and John. Of Hebrew origin; Zebedaeus, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.
To feel fear, lack courage, be distressed, troubled. From a derivative of adeo; to be in distress.
